ArticleTitle.sentence: Synergism between two distinct elements of the HTLV-I enhancer during activation by the trans-activator of HTLV-I.

AbstractText.sentence: We have conducted functional studies of the enhancer elements of human T-cell leukemia virus type I (HTLV-I) using the human T-cell lines Jurkat and MOLT 4, which are negative for HTLV-I, and MT-2 and TL-Mor, which carry the proviral genome of HTLV-I.
Two distinct elements have been implicated in function of the HTLV-I enhancer.

One is the 21-base-pair (bp) core element that is responsible for trans-activation by the HTLV-I trans-activator p40tax and that has the ability to bind to cyclic-AMP responsive element binding factor (CREB)-like factor(s).

event.clue: One is the 21-base-pair (bp) core element that is responsible for trans-activation by the HTLV-I trans-activator p40tax and that has the ability to bind to cyclic-AMP responsive element binding factor (CREB)-like factor(s).

One is the 21-base-pair (bp) core element that is responsible for trans-activation by the HTLV-I trans-activator p40tax and that has the ability to bind to cyclic-AMP responsive element binding factor (CREB)-like factor(s).

One is the 21-base-pair (bp) core element that is responsible for trans-activation by the HTLV-I trans-activator p40tax and that has the ability to bind to cyclic-AMP responsive element binding factor (CREB)-like factor(s).

AbstractText.sentence: The other is a region interposed between the 21-bp elements.

In this study we demonstrate that a subfragment (C26) in the region between the 21-bp elements is involved in trans-activation by p40tax, possibly through binding to an NF-kappa B-like nuclear factor or factors.

event.clue: In this study we demonstrate that a subfragment (C26) in the region between the 21-bp elements is involved in trans-activation by p40tax, possibly through binding to an NF-kappa B-like nuclear factor or factors.

AbstractText.sentence: Formation of the protein-DNA complex with the C26 subfragment was positively affected by p40tax.

event.clue: Formation of the protein-DNA complex with the C26 subfragment was positively affected by p40tax.
Formation of the protein-DNA complex with the C26 subfragment was positively affected by p40tax.

AbstractText.sentence: The C26 element conferred partial responsiveness to p40tax when linked to one copy of the 21-bp element that, by itself, showed little activation in response to p40tax.

event.clue: The C26 element conferred partial responsiveness to p40tax when linked to one copy of the 21-bp element that, by itself, showed little activation in response to p40tax.

AbstractText.sentence: However, the C26 element alone, even when repeated, could not be activated by p40tax, unlike other NF-kappa B-binding elements.

event.clue: However, the C26 element alone, even when repeated, could not be activated by p40tax, unlike other NF-kappa B-binding elements.
However, the C26 element alone, even when repeated, could not be activated by p40tax, unlike other NF-kappa B-binding elements.

AbstractText.sentence: In contrast, the C26 element itself was profoundly activated upon stimulation with 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate.

event.clue: In contrast, the C26 element itself was profoundly activated upon stimulation with 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate.

AbstractText.sentence: These findings therefore suggest that the HTLV-I enhancer contains multiple functional elements, including binding sites for at least CREB- and NF-kappa B-like factors, which synergistically cooperate in activation of the HTLV-I enhancer in response to p40tax.

event.clue: These findings therefore suggest that the HTLV-I enhancer contains multiple functional elements, including binding sites for at least CREB- and NF-kappa B-like factors, which synergistically cooperate in activation of the HTLV-I enhancer in response to p40tax.

AbstractText.sentence: Our results also demonstrate that TPA-dependent activation of the HTLV-I enhancer may be mediated through the C26 element.

event.clue: Our results also demonstrate that TPA-dependent activation of the HTLV-I enhancer may be mediated through the C26 element.
